intro: Vernonanthura nana, commonly known as the dwarf vernonberry, is a low-growing shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and showy, white to pale pink flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are edible and often used in local cuisines. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
